stimulusHtml:
DNA damage can lead to the release of the protein cytochrome c from mitochondria. Cytochrome c then activates the enzyme caspase-9, resulting in the release of more cytochrome c, followed by apoptosis.

Which of the following best explains how the release of cytochrome c from mitochondria is regulated by feedback?
choicesHtml: It is positive feedback because the release of cytochrome c from mitochondria contributes to the production of more mitochondria.
It is negative feedback because the release of cytochrome c from mitochondria results in an increase in cell death.
It is positive feedback because the release of cytochrome c from mitochondria contributes to the release of more cytochrome.
It is negative feedback because the release of cytochrome c from mitochondria is caused by DNA damage.
